item.title: [video] New Report Shows Record Year For Births Of Test Tube Abominations
item.description: Delighted health insurance executives gather in an outdoor coliseum to watch a patient battle cancer, Anderson Cooper decides to keep his recent gay conversion therapy private, and a self-conscious flasher is fully clothed under his trench coat.

item.title: [Video] Sochi’s Euthanized Dogs To Be Returned To Streets After Olympics
item.description: As the games wind down, officials are already starting to return the dead strays to the streets they once called home.

item.title: American Voices: Study: Best, Most Important Memories Made Before Age 25
item.description: A recent study on retirees found that most people make their most important or life-changing memories before age 25, with subjects listing life transitions such as marriage and having children as their most important moments in life.

item.title: Pitchers, Catchers Report To Spring Training Bars
item.description: FT. MYERS, FL—MLB pitchers and catchers reported to spring training bars throughout Arizona and Florida Thursday, arriving early to properly loosen up and get back into drinking shape.

item.title: So-Called Christian Has Erection
item.description: COLORADO SPRINGS, CO—Alarmed and appalled sources confirmed today that in complete defiance of his biblical duty to live a life that is holy and pleasing to God, local 27-year-old and so-called Christian Jeff Daugherty currently has an erection. Dau...

item.title: Report: Maid Of Honor Not Even That Good Of Friends With Bride

item.title: American Voices: Loneliness Raises Risk Of Early Death
item.description: According to a new study by researchers at the University of Chicago, people age 55 and over who regularly feel lonely and isolated have a 14 percent higher risk of early death, partly because loneliness can lead to less restful sleep, high blood pressure...

item.title: American Voices: Nestlé Recalls Hot Pockets

item.title: Sportsgraphic: Revelations From The Wells Report
item.description: With the recent release of Ted Wells’ report, Onion Sports examines what the NFL-ordered investigation discovered about workplace harassment within the Miami Dolphins.

item.title: Open Relationship Gives Couple Freedom To Emotionally Drain Other People From Time To Time
item.description: SCARSDALE, NY—Local couple Alison Fry and Peter Hartman told reporters Thursday they have both been pleased since opening up their relationship, saying the exciting new arrangement allowed them the freedom to psychologically wear down other people.

item.title: Olympic Officials To Have Ski Jumpers Go One At A Time From Now On

item.title: Superstitious Man Puts Bag Of Trash Outside House Every Thursday
item.description: PHILADELPHIA—Admitting that his long-held superstition was a little bizarre, local man Colin Dowd told reporters this morning that he always makes sure to place a bag of trash outside his house every single Thursday.

item.title: Winter Olympics Inspire Nation’s Youth To Try Sports Their Parents Can’t Afford
item.description: WASHINGTON—Inspired by the breathtaking acrobatics and death-defying high speeds of Winter Olympics events, the nation’s youth were reportedly motivated this week to go out and try sports their parents could never possibly afford.

item.description: TRENTON, NJ—In an effort to plan for their newborn daughter’s future, local parents Jonathan and Kate Bradbury have shrewdly begun investing in a college fund that will pay for an estimated 12 weeks of their child’s education, the couple...

item.title: Infographic: Tips For Pulling An All-Nighter
item.description: Getting a good night’s sleep is imperative for good health, but once in a while it’s necessary to stay up all night to get work done.

item.title: Nemesis Lands Alumni Magazine Cover
item.description: ROCKVILLE, MD—Looking through her mail upon returning home from work Monday, Kenyon College graduate Halley Katz was reportedly repulsed and angered to discover that her cursed archrival had landed the cover of her college’s alumni magazine.

item.title: American Voices: Poll: 86% Of NFL Players Okay With Gay Teammate
item.description: ESPN conducted a poll of current NFL players regarding their thoughts on having a gay teammate and found that out of the 51 respondents, 86 percent don’t care about their teammates’ sexual orientation.

item.title: American Voices: Barbie Appears On Cover Of ‘Sports Illustrated’ Swimsuit Issue
item.description: Sports Illustrated celebrated the 50th anniversary of its popular swimsuit issue by featuring Barbie in a one-piece, inciting backlash from critics arguing that the cover promotes the objectification and sexualization of women.
